description:
I configured my setup to work with swift backend. 
my data servers do not have space left. 
when I create an image with --location, the image is created locally and glance is not trying to copy it to swift until we boot an instance. 
since there is no space left on swift, when I try to boot, the instance is simply stuck in scheduling forever.

title: instance stuck in scheduling when image cannot be copied to swift backend

comments.content:
I configured my setup to work with swift backend. 
my data servers do not have space left. 
when I create an image with --location, the image is created locally and glance is not trying to copy it to swift until we boot an instance. 
since there is no space left on swift, when I try to boot, the instance is simply stuck in scheduling forever.

comments.content: The big data dump isn't really helpful.  Are there errors in the nova compute or scheduler logs?  Those would probably be most helpful to know where this fails and how to make sure it gets cleaned up from the scheduler.

comments.content: this bug has been solved by Red Hat and the behaviour no longer happens.
